hypothesis_content.title: Term Structure Inversion as Stress Indicator
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 1-month implied volatility (IV) exceeds 3-month IV by more than 10 volatility points (inverted curve), and the regime is NEUTRAL, the market transitions to STRESS regime within the next 10 trading days with >70% probability, providing a short-volatility opportunity after the stress event peaks.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility term structure inversion indicates near-term fear outweighing longer-term uncertainty, often preceding market stress. Neutral regimes with inversion suggest hidden fragility. Post-stress vol crush provides opportunity.
entry_conditions: Term structure inversion persists for 2 consecutive days
BTC price within 10% of 30-day high (complacency check)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime shifts to STRESS AND VIX > 40, then short vol when VIX drops below 30
exit_conditions.stop_loss: No regime shift within 15 days OR inversion disappears

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Regime transition probability < 50% OR average post-stress vol trade return ≤ 0%.
